quotes.quote: Every effort has been made to locate copyright holders and, if any material has been used without proper permission, the editor would appreciate being notified so that proper credit can be given in future editions.
The primary purpose of copyright, then, is not to enrich authors; rather, it is to promote the progress of science and useful arts—  that is, human knowledge.
Copyright is a legal device that provides the creator of a work of art or literature, or a work that conveys information or ideas, the right to control how the work is used.
A copyright is a type of property— it belongs to its owner (usually the author) , and the courts can be asked to intervene if anyone uses it without permission.
Copyright lasts for the life of the work's creator (its author) plus 70 years.
Copyright does not protect ideas or facts; it protects only the unique way in which ideas or facts are expressed.
The term copyright is a highly descriptive term: the right to make copies.
Copyright licensing is used to make works available to the public for free.
Copyright should be about policy, not property.
Ideas cannot be copyrighted.
Copying is shorthand for the infringing of any of the copyright owner's exclusive rights as described in the Copyright Act.
